content.title: National Family Benefit Scheme - Uttar Pradesh
content.beneficiary: Families below poverty line who have lost their lead earners
content.details: The NFBS, also known as Rashtriya Parivarik Labh Yojana, was started by the UP government in January 2016. Under this scheme, families who have lost their lead earners will receive a lump sum amount of money as compensation. To claim the compensation, one must apply to register under the scheme. The entire application process is available only online, with no provision for offline application.
benefits: Support for families below the poverty line after the death of the lead earner
eligibility: Must be living below the poverty line
Family income should not exceed Rs. 56,450/- in urban areas and Rs. 46,080/- in rural areas
content.application_process: Applicants need to visit the official website, download the application form, submit the filled form at the District Magistrate's office, and enclose required documents.
documents_required: Below poverty line ration card (blue card)

faqs.question: Is this scheme applicable for those who are alive?
faqs.answer: No, this is only for those below the poverty line who have lost their lead earner.

faqs.question: What are the age criteria?
faqs.answer: The applicant should be aged between 18 years to 60 years.

faqs.question: How can I apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Visit the official website and fill out the application form online.
